item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Passes Another Major Milestone
item.description:
The Nintendo Switch 2 has sold over 2 million units in the U.S. alone. It's been a big year for the much-anticipated console, which has seen record-breaking sales figures after a rocky pre-order situation and controversy over its use of game key cards. In addition, the sales success continues, with the Nintendo Switch 2 passing this recent milestone faster than its predecessor.

Despite complaints from gamers about its price and its handling of physical game cartridges, Nintendo's latest console has performed remarkably well. In July, the Switch 2 surpassed 6 million copies sold worldwide, taking less than two months to reach that impressive figure. Games like Donkey Kong Bananza and Mario Kart World have also been major hits, and it seems things still aren't slowing down for Nintendo.

Nintendo Switch 2 Has Sold Over 2 Million Units in the U.S.

Games industry analyst Mat Piscatella recently shared that the Switch 2 had passed 2 million units sold in the U.S. on Bluesky, revealing that those sales were enough to drive a 21% monthly increase in hardware spending. He also pointed out how the console is now 75% ahead of the pace of the original Switch at this point in the system's lifecycle. Piscatella himself had predicted that the Switch 2 would not outsell the original, although that was before Nintendo revealed it and pre-orders rapidly sold out. There's always a chance sales could slow down before it surpasses the OG Switch, but so far, the Switch 2 has set a breakneck pace.

Comparisons to its predecessor are not the only thing impressive about the Switch 2's recent milestone. Piscatella also revealed that hardware sales for both the PS5 and Xbox Series X/S fell by 47% and 69%, respectively, in July. That means Nintendo more than made up for significant declines among its competitors to lift the overall market. The Switch 2 has already passed the lifetime sales of the Series X and S in Japan, but now it's carrying the gaming hardware sector in the U.S., at least for the moment.

Unsurprisingly, the Switch 2 remains the best-selling piece of video game hardware in the U.S. for both July and 2025 as a whole. However, the system's massive success may make things all the more frustrating for some companies and gamers. There are reports that third-party studios are struggling to get Switch 2 dev kits, which could lead to fewer indie titles on the platform. Things could change in the future, as the system is still new, but for now, things are uncertain. What is certain, though, is that the Switch 2 has been good news for Nintendo.

item.title: Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar - Everything Included in the DLC Packs
item.description:
Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar was released alongside a couple of DLC packs. While some of this additional content is purely cosmetic, some includes unique features that fans might want to own.

This article shows players all of the available DLC options for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar on launch and information on each pack's cost, so players can thoroughly look at their options before deciding whether any of the DLC content is for them or if they'd rather skip it for now and perhaps reconsider in the future.

All Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar DLC Content & Prices

Below, players can read up on all of the additional content available for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar :

Pine Hoverfly Set

The Pine Hoverfly set is a cosmetic DLC for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar . It costs $1.99 and includes a matching set of three items:

  • Pine Hoverfly sweater
  • Pine Hoverfly beanie
  • Pine Hoverfly glider

While the sweater and beanie are available as soon as players gain access to their house in Zephyr Town, the latter will only be accessible once players have progressed enough into the story and unlocked the glider.

Trunk of Transformation

The Trunk of Transformation is another cosmetic set available for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar . Players can get it for $9.99 , and it includes a handful of items: four hairstyles, two animal costume sets, and the ninja set, which includes an outfit, a glider, and a bazaar set.

  • Braid & Flowers hairstyle
  • Cat Ear Buns with Highlights hairstyle
  • Short Perm hairstyle
  • Side Part with Highlights hairstyle
  • Chick costume sets
  • Alpaca costume sets
  • Ninja set

Similar to the Pine Hoverfly set, players will have access to cosmetic items right away, but the glider and bazaar set require players to progress further into the story of Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar .

Super Digital DLC Set

The Super Digital DLC Set costs $19.99 , and it includes the Trunk of Transformation cosmetic set as well as the Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar digital soundtrack and digital art book.

  • Trunk of Transformation DLC
  • Digital soundtrack
  • Digital art book

Are the DLC Packs for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar Worth the Price?

If players consider themselves big fans of Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar , then they will have a splendid time exploring the digital art book while they listen to the game's soundtrack .

They can have a peaceful experience looking through the various pages, as they learn the ins and outs of Zephyr Town, read unique character descriptions and information, and look through the production art and illustrations for Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar . In this case, the Super Digital DLC Set would definitely be worth the price, especially since it includes the Trunk of Transformation pack, which has quite a few items and sets.

The Trunk of Transformation is best for fans who are interested in expanding their in-game warbrode , especially if they enjoy silly, animal-themed costumes. If they're looking for something more affordable , they might want to consider the Pine Hoverfly set instead.

In Story of Seasons: Grand Bazaar , players receive DLC content in the mail, so to claim it, the only thing they have to do is interact with their mailbox .

item.title: This Upcoming 'Genshin Impact Killer' Has a Huge Ace Up Its Sleeve
item.description:
Genshin Impact may not be the first gacha game of its kind, but when it made its debut in 2020, it singlehandedly popularized the genre in international markets. Ever since the game achieved massive critical and commercial success back then, several companies have attempted to cash in on the trend that it started with new gacha titles of their own. Last year, for example, the Chinese developer Kuro Games released Wuthering Waves , a free-to-play open-world RPG with real-time combat and a post-apocalyptic setting. A few months ago, meanwhile, Mingzhou Studio launched the hack-and-slash action RPG Black Beacon on iOS and Android. Even Hotta Studio, the company behind Tower of Fantasy , recently announced a Genshin Impact -like anime RPG called Neverness to Everness .

Despite the influx of anime-inspired gacha games in the last few years, none of them have really succeeded in their attempts to knock Genshin Impact off its throne. Many of these titles often suffer from similar issues, like a lack of innovation in gameplay, an unnecessary emphasis on grinding, and an egregious amount of pay-to-win mechanics. While Genshin Impact is also plagued by some of these same problems, it is still arguably better than most other gacha games in several respects. That said, there is one upcoming title that seems to easily surpass Genshin in one particular area.

Duet Night Abyss Seems to Be a Lot More Player-Friendly Compared to Genshin Impact

Back in 2023, Hero Games and its subsidiary, Pan Studio, announced a third-person free-to-play action game called Duet Night Abyss . Described by its developers as a "high-freedom fantasy adventure RPG," the game takes place in a land where demons run rampant and machinery and magic are parts of everyday life. It features a hack-and-slash combat system and follows two playable protagonists. These characters not only come from completely different backgrounds, but they also have full storylines of their own.

Unlike Its Free-to-Play Contemporaries, Duet Night Abyss Will Not Feature Any Gacha Elements

Since its initial reveal, Hero Games and Pan Studio have hosted multiple closed betas for Duet Night Abyss . Recently, however, the two companies confirmed that the game will be launched worldwide for PC, iOS, and Android on October 28. Alongside this news, Pan Studio announced some major adjustments to the monetization systems in Duet Night Abyss . It revealed that, in order to make the game more consumer-friendly, it decided to make all the characters and weapons in Duet Night Abyss free to unlock. In addition to this, the studio confirmed that it got rid of the game's banners, its star rating system, and the time limitations it had for grinding.

Duet Night Abyss features a mechanic called the Sigil System, which lets players summon AI-controlled companions during combat in order to reduce grind.

With the sweeping changes that have been made to it, Duet Night Abyss is effectively no longer a gacha game. This, however, is probably a good thing. Most of the free-to-play action RPGs on the market these days are filled to the brim with gambling mechanics and systems that don't respect the player's time. Genshin Impact 's gacha system, of course, is guilty of these anti-consumer practices, as well. The game's event banners, pity system, and star rating system are all designed to extract as much money from players as possible. Although Genshin is still more generous compared to other gacha games out there, many gamers are probably tired of having to deal with features like these.

Players Who Are Tired of Gacha Mechanics Could Leave Genshin Impact for Duet Night Abyss

If Duet Night Abyss actually sticks the landing and is filled with high-quality content at launch, it could actually pose a legitimate threat to Genshin Impact and games like it. Gamers who want to experience a free-to-play RPG that doesn't fall into the trappings of the gacha game genre may be more inclined to check Duet Night Abyss out compared to other titles. Although it isn't exactly the same as Genshin Impact in the gameplay and story departments, Duet Night Abyss could at least serve as a solid replacement for lapsed fans of the game.

item.title: Pokemon GO Wild Area 2025 Announced, Will Include New Pokemon Debuts
item.description:
Pokemon GO has announced Wild Area 2025, which will introduce the Impidimp evolutionary line to the hit mobile game. The event is also set to expand Pokemon GO 's shiny pool and offer a variety of other content.

The first iteration of Pokemon GO 's Wild Area took place in November 2024. It started with a special in-person event in Fukuoka, Japan, on November 16 and 17, followed by a global debut a week later. The event featured Gigantamax Toxtricity and the then-new GO Safari Ball.

Nearly a year after Niantic announced Pokemon GO 's Wild Area 2024, the company has confirmed the event will return this year. Wild Area 2025 will kick off in Nagasaki City, where an in-person event is planned for the November 7–9 period. This will be followed by a two-day global celebration taking place on November 15 and 16. Impidimp, Morgrem, and Grimmsnarl will make their Pokémon GO debuts throughout both instances, with the Dark/Fairy dual-type mons being positioned as the highlights of the happening.

Pokemon GO Wild Area 2025 Schedule

  • November 7–9 : Nagasaki City, Japan event
  • November 15–16 : Global event

The general idea behind the new Wild Area event is the same as its predecessor's, with Niantic looking to evoke the open, dynamic feel of hunting for pocket monsters in the recent mainline games. To that end, the event will see Pokemon GO 's Mighty Pokemon make a return, serving as elusive wild encounters that have higher stats and can even be paired with some special moves their regular counterparts don't have access to. Shadow Darkrai and Shadow Cresselia will also appear in five-star raids for the duration of the event.

Wild Area 2025 will also see Shiny Hatenna debut in the popular mobile game, being implemented as a wild encounter. Pokemon GO players can also expect two rotating spawn hours featuring different mons. The first of those sounds like something from Persona 3 , being called the Lurking Dark Hour, featuring spawn such as Alolan Meowth and Grimer, Gastly, Seedot, Skorupi, Stunky, and over a dozen other pocket monsters. Fanciful Fairy Hour will follow with increased spawn chances for Clefairy, Alolan Vulpix, Jigglypuff, Galarian Ponyta, Marill, Ralts, and many other Fairy-type mons.

The GO Safari Ball will return as a key item for capturing tough targets for the duration of the event. Players who purchase event tickets will receive access to Special Research with Dark or Fairy paths, avatar rewards, and increased Shiny odds. Limited-time research tasks will also feature thematically tied Pokemon. Looking at the big picture, Wild Area 2025 appears to reinforce Niantic's commitment to hybrid Pokemon GO events as a way to maintain interest in its 2016 game with a varied assortment of offerings.

Pokemon GO Wild Area 2025 Overview

Pokemon Debuts and Other Key Features

  • Grimmsnarl family debuts : Impidimp, Morgrem, and Grimmsnarl appear for the first time in Pokémon GO.
  • Shadow Raids :
    • Saturday: Shadow Cresselia (Shiny possible)
    • Sunday: Shadow Darkrai (Shiny possible)

  • Mighty Pokémon encounters return:
    • Rare, high-stat spawns with a chance to be Shiny
    • Best caught using GO Safari Balls

  • Timed rotating wild encounters :
    • Lurking Dark Hour: Focused on Dark-types like Deino, Zorua, Galarian Zigzagoon
    • Fanciful Fairy Hour: Focused on Fairy-types like Ralts, Hatenna, Galarian Ponyta

Ticket Holder Bonuses

  • Special Research : Choose a Dark or Fairy path to earn themed medals
  • Increased Shiny odds for all event Pokémon
  • Exclusive avatar item (Flower Crown) for web store purchases
  • Extra Incense spawns , including Shiny Unown W and Lake Guardians (Uxie, Mesprit, Azelf)
  • 6 Special Trades per day , half Stardust cost
  • 6 free Raid Passes per day , up to 18 with Battle Ready add-on

Paid Add-Ons

  • Battle Ready : Up to 18 daily Raid Passes, extra Candy and XP from raids
  • Egg-thusiast : 1/4 Hatch Distance, 3× XP, Candy, Stardust from hatches
  • Extra Day : Adds extra play day in Nagasaki with most features

In-Person Extras (Nagasaki City)

  • Full-city gameplay (not park-limited)
  • Exclusive GO Wild Area 2025 glow-in-the-dark T-shirt (preorder only)
  • Photo ops, Community Hub, and merch pop-up shops

The live event ticket for Pokemon GO Wild Area 2025 will be priced at ¥3,600 (~$24.50), including applicable taxes and fees.

item.title: Best Duos In Metal Gear History
item.description:
Summary

  • Metal Gear's cast grew richer over the decades, with complex characters and behind‑the‑scenes allies.
  • Iconic pairings include Solid Snake & Otacon, The End and his parrot, and Venom Snake with D.D.
  • Both heroes and villains form duos—sometimes human, sometimes animal—across both main games and spinoffs.

Metal Gear began in 1987, and even with the initial version, there were a lot of characters involved in the story. It was ahead of its time as a Japanese PC game, and these characters only got more elaborate as time went on. While Solid Snake and other heroes mostly faced their challenges in the field alone, they did have help behind the scenes.

Also, the villains in Metal Gear tend to work solo but as part of larger organizations. Were there any that worked in pairs? Let’s go through the decades of Metal Gear characters and find if there are any memorable duos out there on either the good or bad side.

Solid Snake And Otacon (Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons Of Liberty)

The Philanthropy Founders

Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty
9.2 /10
Released
November 13, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Animated Blood, Animated Violence
Powered by

After the events of Metal Gear Solid , Solid Snake and Hal Emmerich, aka Otacon , went their separate ways from their previous allegiances and started Philanthropy. It was a peaceful organization aimed at stopping anyone who threatened the balance of the world.

They formed a strong bond in Metal Gear Solid 2: Sons of Liberty , as Otacon served as Snake’s go-to contact while he was in the field. That bond grew stronger in Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots as the two continued their efforts to keep the peace despite Snake’s aging body.

The End And His Parrot (Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater)

Beware His Squawks

Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater (2004)
9.6 /10
Released
November 17, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes
Powered by

Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater is full of memorable boss battles, and for some, The End is their favorite. The End is a skilled sniper who is at the end of his life in the game. He’s accompanied by a parrot whose job is to keep him awake during battles, as The End is constantly slipping in and out of consciousness.

Savvy players can also use the parrot as a guiding beacon to find The End, who is also a master of camouflage and is hiding in a dense jungle throughout his boss fight. The parrot ultimately leads The End to the finale he deserved as a loyal soldier. Today, new players can experience this dynamic duo in the game's remake, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater .

Drebin And Little Gray (Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns Of The Patriots)

Monkeys Love Soda

Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots
8.5 /10
Released
June 12, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Crude Humor, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Drebin served as Solid Snake’s weapon handler in Metal Gear Solid 4: Guns of the Patriots . He could make any weapon usable by Snake by altering the weapon’s ID chips. While hiding in his back alley shop, Drebin typically sent out his monkey pal, Little Gray , on errands.

Little Gray did whatever he was told because Drebin provided him with all the soda he could drink. Soda was probably not the best thing to give to a monkey, but Little Gray and Drebin had a good working relationship going on. Drebin may have been a stone-cold weapons dealer, but that didn’t mean he couldn’t have a soft spot for Little Gray.

Venom Snake And D.D. (Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain)

Diamond Dogs Are Forever

Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain
9 /10
7.9 /10
Released
September 1, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language
Powered by

In Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain , Big Boss was rebranded as Venom Snake, and players could take a couple of different partners into the field with them. The one most players fell in love with was D.D., or Diamond Dog.

D.D. was a wolf pup that Snake saved early in the game, and after some training at Mother Base, Snake could then take D.D. into the field. Even though Snake didn’t talk much, and D.D. obviously couldn’t talk, as he's a dog, it was still clear that they had formed a good partnership.

Kazuhira Miller And Revolver Ocelot (Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain)

Building A Better Tomorrow

Revolver Ocelot was bested by Big Boss in Metal Gear Solid 3: Snake Eater, but later joined his ranks in Metal Gear Solid 5: The Phantom Pain with Big Boss’ acting under a new name, Venom Snake.

Now an older and wiser man, Ocelot became Snake’s advisor and right-hand man. He took care of mission planning and strategizing at Mother Base alongside Kazuhira Miller . Even though Snake was technically in charge of Mother Base, Miller and Ocelot were definitely the heart and brains of the operation, since Snake was a man of few words and made the biggest impact out in the field rather than around the war table.

Solid Snake And Teliko Friedman (Metal Gear Acid)

A Hit Of Acid

Metal Gear Acid
6.0 /10
Released
March 22, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature 17+
Powered by

Metal Gear Acid is one of the odder spinoffs in the franchise. It’s an alternate history game et apart from Metal Gear Solid’s events, and it’s a tactical card-based RPG. Solid Snake is eventually accompanied by his female partner, Teliko Friedman , who is his one and only party member.

In Metal Gear Acid 2 , Teliko gets replaced by Venus. Both serve the same functionality for Snake, but Teliko is the more likable partner, as she often challenges Snake’s beliefs. It’s a unique dynamic since most games don’t give heroes like Snake partners.

Slasher Hawk And Bunjil (Metal Gear: Ghost Babel)

More Like Boomerang Hawk

Metal Gear: Ghost Babel
Stealth
Systems
Released
May 5, 2000

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Metal Gear: Ghost Babel is another spinoff with alternate events to the main Metal Gear Solid timeline. It’s still a top-down stealth-action game, but the missions are level-based for more bite-sized consumption on the Game Boy Color.

Slasher Hawk is one of the main bosses of the game, accompanied by his hawk, Bunjil . In the first phase of the battle, Snake has to dodge Hawk’s boomerang, and in the second half, he has to dodge the boomerang and Bunjil. While things don’t end well for Hawk, he and Bunjil had a good run together as soldiers.
